columns.text: In this problem, we will identify the number of orders that a company should place and when they should place it based on their strategy as well as the demands of the market.

In a business that sells goods, the amount of products that you order as well as the time you order them are important as it can help you maximize your profits and cut down on expected losses. 

This problem will help us identify the appropriate number of stocks to be ordered as well as when the orders should be placed.

To do this, we must first determine how many suits are expected for the whole year. Since the given is that the company expects $700$ suits per week, we can multiply it to the number of weeks in a year which is $52$.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total number of suits}&=700\times52\\[15 pt]
&=36,400
\end{aligned}$$

This shows that the company expects a total of $36,400$ suits for the whole year.

The economic order quantity (EOC) refers to the ideal order size of a company that will help them prevent overspending. In the case of this problem, the EOC of the company is at $500$ suits per week. From the total number of suits expected, we can then solve for the number of times that the company will order these suits at the economic order quantity. To do this, we can simply divide the total number by the EOC.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Expected orders per year}&=\dfrac{36,400}{500}\\[15 pt]
&=72.8
\end{aligned}$$

The company is expected to order $72.8$ times in a given year.

Now, to determine when the company should place each order, we can first see that there is a total of $600$ suits ($500$ from the order and $100$ for the safety stock).

Since the company expects $700$ orders per week and the number of orders per day is equal, then there will be $100$ suits per day. 

This means that if the first delivery is on Monday, the number of stocks will last until Friday.

The safety stock should not be consumed since this is only for unexpected orders, this means that the store should order before Saturday.

It is stated in the problem that the amount of time it takes before the order gets delivered is $3$ days. Therefore, to get the right da to place an order, we must backtrack $3$ days from Saturday which gives us Wednesday.

This means that the orders should be placed on **Wednesday** to ensure enough stocks to fulfill the orders while still staying on the economic order quantity (EOC).
